# iosxr_ptp_profile (Data Source)

This data source can read the PTP Profile configuration.

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "iosxr_ptp_profile" "example" {
  profile_name = "Profile-1"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `profile_name` (String) PTP Profile Configuration

### Optional

- `device` (String) A device name from the provider configuration.

### Read-Only

- `announce_frequency` (String) Send Announce messages one or more times a second
- `announce_grant_duration` (Number) Configure the announce unicast grant duration value
- `announce_interval` (String) Send Announce messages once every one or more seconds
- `announce_timeout` (Number) Configure the announce timeout value
- `clock_operation_one_step` (Boolean) One-step clock-operation
- `clock_operation_two_step` (Boolean) Two-step clock-operation
- `cos` (Number) Specify the COS value to use
- `cos_event` (Number) Specify the COS value to use
- `cos_general` (Number) Specify the COS value to use
- `delay_asymmetry_unit_microseconds` (Boolean) Use microseconds as the delay asymmetry units
- `delay_asymmetry_unit_milliseconds` (Boolean) Use milliseconds as the delay asymmetry units
- `delay_asymmetry_unit_nanoseconds` (Boolean) Use nanoseconds as the delay asymmetry units
- `delay_asymmetry_value` (Number) Delay asymmetry to apply to all primarys on an interface
- `delay_request_frequency` (String) Send Announce messages one or more times a second
- `delay_request_interval` (String) Send Announce messages once every one or more seconds
- `delay_response_grant_duration` (Number) Configure the delay-response unicast grant duration value
- `delay_response_timeout` (Number) Configure the delay-response timeout value
- `dscp` (Number) Specify the DSCP value to use
- `dscp_event` (Number) Specify the DSCP value to use
- `dscp_general` (Number) Specify the DSCP value to use
- `id` (String) The path of the retrieved object.
- `interop_domain` (Number) Domain of the peer clock
- `interop_egress_conversion_clock_accuracy` (Number) The clock-accuracy value to use for the peer clock
- `interop_egress_conversion_clock_class_default` (Number) Default clock class to use when a more specific mapping is not available
- `interop_egress_conversion_clock_class_mappings` (Attributes List) Specific mapping for a given clock class value (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--interop_egress_conversion_clock_class_mappings))
- `interop_egress_conversion_offset_scaled_log_variance` (Number) The OSLV value to use for the peer clock
- `interop_egress_conversion_priority1` (Number) The priority1 value to use for the peer clock
- `interop_egress_conversion_priority2` (Number) The priority2 value to use for the peer clock
- `interop_ingress_conversion_clock_accuracy` (Number) The clock-accuracy value to use for the peer clock
- `interop_ingress_conversion_clock_class_default` (Number) Default clock class to use when a more specific mapping is not available
- `interop_ingress_conversion_clock_class_mappings` (Attributes List) Specific mapping for a given clock class value (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--interop_ingress_conversion_clock_class_mappings))
- `interop_ingress_conversion_offset_scaled_log_variance` (Number) The OSLV value to use for the peer clock
- `interop_ingress_conversion_priority1` (Number) The priority1 value to use for the peer clock
- `interop_ingress_conversion_priority2` (Number) The priority2 value to use for the peer clock
- `interop_profile_default` (Boolean) Default profile
- `interop_profile_g_8265_1` (Boolean) G.8265.1 telecom profile
- `interop_profile_g_8275_1` (Boolean) G.8275.1 telecom profile
- `interop_profile_g_8275_2` (Boolean) G.8275.2 telecom profile
- `ipv4_ttl` (Number) Specify the IPv4 TTL value to use
- `ipv6_hop_limit` (Number) Specify the IPv6 hop limit value to use
- `master_ethernets` (Attributes List) Ethernet address (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--master_ethernets))
- `master_ipv4s` (Attributes List) IPv4 address (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--master_ipv4s))
- `master_ipv6s` (Attributes List) IPv6 address (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--master_ipv6s))
- `multicast` (Boolean) Allow multicast messages to be sent
- `multicast_disable` (Boolean) Disable multicast transport
- `multicast_mixed` (Boolean) Mixed-mode multicast
- `multicast_target_address_ethernet_mac_address_01_1b_19_00_00_00` (Boolean) Forwardable mac-address
- `multicast_target_address_ethernet_mac_address_01_80_c2_00_00_0e` (Boolean) Non-forwardable mac-address
- `port_state_any` (Boolean) Allow any port state
- `port_state_master_only` (Boolean) Restrict the port state to primary
- `port_state_slave_only` (Boolean) Restrict the port state to subordinate
- `slave_ethernets` (Attributes List) Ethernet address (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--slave_ethernets))
- `slave_ipv4s` (Attributes List) IPv4 address (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--slave_ipv4s))
- `slave_ipv6s` (Attributes List) IPv6 address (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--slave_ipv6s))
- `source_ipv4_address` (String) Set the IPv4 address to use when sending IPv4 packets
- `source_ipv6_address` (String) Set the IPv6 address to use when sending IPv6 packets
- `sync_frequency` (String) Send Announce messages one or more times a second
- `sync_grant_duration` (Number) Configure the sync unicast grant duration value
- `sync_interval` (String) Send Announce messages once every one or more seconds
- `sync_timeout` (Number) Configure the sync timeout value
- `transport_ethernet` (Boolean) Ethernet transport
- `transport_ipv4` (Boolean) IPv4 transport
- `transport_ipv6` (Boolean) IPv6 transport
- `unicast_grant_invalid_request_deny` (Boolean) Deny grant
- `unicast_grant_invalid_request_reduce` (Boolean) Reduce grant parameters

<a id="nestedatt--master_ethernets"></a>
### Nested Schema for `master_ethernets`

Read-Only:

- `address` (String) Ethernet address
- `clock_class` (Number) Override the clock-class of this primary
- `delay_asymmetry` (Number) The expected delay asymmetry for this primary
- `microseconds` (Boolean) Use microseconds as the delay asymmetry units
- `milliseconds` (Boolean) Use milliseconds as the delay asymmetry units
- `multicast` (Boolean) Whether this primary sends messages multicast
- `multicast_mixed` (Boolean) Mixed-mode multicast
- `nanoseconds` (Boolean) Use nanoseconds as the delay asymmetry units
- `non_negotiated` (Boolean) Use non-negotiated unicast
- `priority` (Number) Specify the priority of this primary
